turn_structure.description: Each combat round lasts 6 seconds. On your turn, you can move and take one action. You may also perform a bonus action or reaction if a feature allows it.

rules: You don't have to move on your turn.
Your total movement cannot exceed your speed.
You can move before or after taking an action, or split movement around actions.
Movement includes walking, jumping, climbing, and other reasonable methods.
You may take one action on your turn.
You don't have to take an action.
Common actions include attacking, casting a spell, and using an object.
If you can make multiple attacks, you can move between attacks if speed allows.

bonus_actions.description: Some abilities, spells, or features allow an additional action called a bonus action.
rules: Only one bonus action is allowed per round.
Example: Dual-wielding allows an off-hand attack as a bonus action.

reactions.description: A special action triggered by a specific event, usable once per round.
rules: Can occur during another creature’s turn.
Examples include: casting Feather Fall when falling, or making an opportunity attack when a creature moves out of your reach.

free_activities: Draw ammunition for a ranged weapon

attack.description: Make one melee or ranged attack. Features may allow more.

cast_spell.description: Cast a spell that has a casting time of one action.

dash.description: Move up to twice your speed (double movement).

dodge.description: Until your next turn, attackers have disadvantage and you have advantage on Dexterity saves.

help.description: Grant an ally advantage on an attack against a creature within 5 feet or assist with a task.

use_object.description: Use or manipulate an object beyond free interaction (e.g., drinking a potion).

ready.description: Choose a trigger and prepare an action or spell as a reaction. Requires concentration for spells.

hide.description: Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to become hidden.

search.description: Look for something hidden, using Wisdom or Intelligence as required by the DM.

improvise.description: Attempt a creative or unusual action outside the standard options. May require DM approval and checks.

rules: You must declare a specific triggering event and the action you'll take.
The readied action becomes a reaction.
Only one reaction per round — using it for the readied action replaces any other reaction.
You must concentrate if the readied action is a spell.
Requires DM approval.
May involve a check with a difficulty class.
Examples: jumping on a creature or swinging from a chandelier.
Failure could lead to consequences like falling prone or losing movement.

surprise.description: If surprised at the start of combat, you lose your first turn, including reactions, until round two.
